info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 9:16PM EDT until July 23 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Walton.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... De Funiak Springs, Eglin Air Force Base, Union, Liberty, Paxton, Alpine Heights, De Funiak Spring Airport, Piney Grove, Sand Hill, Cluster Springs, Center Ridge, Pleasant Ridge, Oakwood Hills, Glendale, Pleasant Hill, Fox Hill, Caney Creek, New Harmony, Argyle and Mossy Head. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING
